header.title: Boris Johnson brings in loyal army of aides in safe Tory seats as he starts election fight
header.subtitle: SENIOR Tory aides have been selected to fight for Conservative safe seats ahead of December’s general election.
header.postText: A number of Boris Johnson’s senior aides are set to enter Parliament next month after being selected to stand in Conservative safe seats. Recognisable faces such as Dominic Raab and Rishi Sunak will momentarily swap their advisory roles for the green benches of Parliament.', 'Others thought to almost certainly stand include the Prime Minister’s Brexit adviser, business adviser and political secretary.', 'Yesterday, Andrew Griffith, Mr Johnson’s chief business advisor was selected to fight Arundel and South Downs in the south east, near Luton.', 'Nick Herbert, who has held the seat since 2005, is standing down.', 'At the last election Mr Herbert had a 40 percent majority over Labour.', 'Mr Griffith was chief financial officer and chief operating officer of Sky before he joined Downing Street.', 'We was formerly the Conservative candidate in Corby in the 2001 and 2005 general elections, finishing second both times.', 'The closing days of the Conservative leadership campaign this summer saw Mr Johnson use Mr Griffith’s grade II listed Westminster townhouse to plan his first days in office.', 'Another advisor, James Wild, Mr Johnson’s Brexit aide, was last night selected to fight the seat of North West Norfolk.', 'Here, the Conservatives have a majority of 28 percent, having been held since 2001 by Sir Henry Bellingham.', 'Mr Wild advised Sir Michael Fallon when he was defence secretary and Sir David Lidington when he was Theresa May’s deputy, before then turning his attention to Mr Johnson.', 'Baroness Evans of Bowes Park, his wife, has been leader of the House of Lords since 2016.', 'Then, the Prime Minister’s political secretary, Danny Kruger, was selected to replace Claire Perry to stand in Devizes, a town in central Wiltshire.', 'At the last election Ms Perry had a majority of 42 percent.', 'Mr Kruger previously led negotiations with Labour MPs to back Mr Johnson’s Brexit Deal, and was previously David Cameron’s speechwriter.', 'His mother, Prue Leith, is a judge on the Great British Bake off.', 'Simon Jupp has been selected to replace Sir Hugo Swire in East Devon.', 'In East Surrey, Claire Coutinho stands in the place of Sam Gyimah after he defected to the Liberal Democrats to sit in Kensington.', 'A former adviser to Mr Johnson who has been selected to stand in South Cambridgeshire has faced controversy after being accused by Labour of being “disgusting racism”.', 'Anthony Browne, in an article for The Spectator in 2002, wrote: “It is not through letting in terrorists that the government’s policy of mass migration — especially from the third world — will claim the most lives. It is through letting in too many germs.”', 'He also wrote that “curbing the influx of HIV immigrants” would be more effective than tackling HIV by telling people to wear condoms.', 'Mr Browne was formerly a journalist at The Times and The Observer, going on to become a policy director for Mr Johnson when he was mayor of London.',  'When his writings were criticised at the time, he said he had gone through a “phase of being deliberately contrary and deliberately provocative”, adding: I do very much regret any offence caused by any past newspaper articles.', 'It really never was my intention to cause offence, but to provoke debate.', 'The articles, which I deeply regret writing, also don’t give a fair reflection of my views.', 'I want to make clear that I am emphatically not anti-immigration.

replies.commentText: Has this been publicly declared ? I have not heard it and will need to. All of us BREXITEERS will need to know whether we are voting for a person who has tried to STOP BREXIT for the last THREE years because we will NOT be doing so in that case. If true it must mean HALF the tory MPs have been DESELECTED and I just CANNOT believe that. There is a difference between voting for the Boris SURRENDER TREATY because of the threat of DESELECTION and genuinely wanting to LEAVE the EU. I remain UNCONVINCED and if not certain I will ABSTAIN.

You are mixing up the Surrender Act brought in by Liebour Benn.  Boris' WA takes us out of the eu on or before 31 Jan 2020. If you abstain, then you cannot consider yourself a dedicated Brexiteer.That is simply a silly attitude

By what measure does Boris's deal take us OUT of the EU ? Do we still pay Brussels ? Yes. Are we still under the ECJ ? Yes. Do we still have to obey EU rules ? Yes. Do we have control of our waters ? No Does free movement end ? No Can we change our tax laws ? No Can we bail - out troubled British companies ? No Can the leave date be extended ? Yes There is more but I believe that illustrates that the deal does NOT take us out of the EU

commentThread.commentText: Brexit is far too important to play tip toe through the tulips. Fair play to NF for accepting that he read Boris Johnson's game plan wrong and he needs to pull more of his troops such as in North Norfolk if he really wants that clean Brexit.

replies.commentText: Quite the contrary! He needs to reinstate all those candidates that he pulled out!  Both Nigel and Boris are perfectly well aware of where the tory safe seats are. The tories only need 9 more MP's for a majority. Nigel should work out those constituencies that have the greatest chance of returning tories and put TBP candidates back in 265 constituencies, thus giving the tories 50 seats in which to gain 9!

I think you assume too much. Those seats are not nailed on for the Tories as this will be a deeply cynical election and the remainers will be up to their usual tricks of trying to block Brexit the 'dirty way'. Now that NF accepts that Boris 's plan IS Brexit, surely a Brexiteer Conservative is the same as a Brexit Party MP.... or are you more about tribalism than securing Brexit?
